Alex wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I am looking at the recover job feature.  Correct me if I am wrong, but is
> it only able to reload the urls that it visited and the ones that are 
> on the
> queue, and doesn't load up the information originally associated with the
> CrawlURI object or CandidateURI object?

Thats about right.  It reconstitutes CrawlURI instances using a line 
from the recover log (Checkout the content of recover log).

Perhaps the 1.6 checkpointing feature would be of use.  See 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#checkpoint.  As 
long as what you add to CrawlURI is serializable it should persist 
across a checkpoint recovery.

>
> I need to store information in a CandidateURI, so when it becomes a 
> CrawlURI
> I can do something with it depending on an associatated value using the
> putObject/getObject methods, that has been passed through the 
> Frontier.  As
> long as the Frontier thinks it isn't a URL that we have already visited.
>
Should work.  When a CandidateURI is promoted to CrawlURI, the content 
of the list filled with putObject is migrated. Let us know if it doesn't 
work for you.
St.Ack

> Regards,
> Alex
